alert.note: Alert for Lane (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 03 at 9:23PM PST until December 04 at 8:19AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Oregon... Siuslaw River near Mapleton affecting Lane County. For the Nw Oregon / Sw Washington Coast...including Mapleton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Siuslaw River near Mapleton. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 18.0 feet, expect minor flooding of low lying lands, mostly pastures and dairy land, as well as some structures right along the banks of the Siuslaw River in and near Mapleton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PST Sunday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM PST Sunday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river crested at 18.7 feet at Mapleton early Sunday evening. The river will continue to slowly recede tonight and Monday, dropping below flood stage later tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 600 AM PST.
